documentation.text:
@notice return raw data of a staker for an epoch
        WARN: should be used only for initialized data
         if data has not been initialized, it will return all 0
         pool master shouldn't use this function to compute/distribute rewards of pool members
@dev  in KyberDao contract, if staker wants to claim reward for past epoch,
      we must know the staker's data for that epoch
      if the data has not been initialized, it means staker hasn't done any action -> no reward

handleWithdrawal(address,uint256,uint256.details: separate logics from withdraw, so staker can withdraw as long as amount <= staker's deposit amount calling this function from withdraw function, ignore reverting

initAndReturnStakerDataForCurrentEpoch(a.details: initialize data if needed, then return staker's data for current epochfor safe, only allow calling this func from KyberDao address

params.staker: - staker's address to initialize and get data for

withdraw(uint256).details: call to withdraw KNC from staking, it could affect reward when calling KyberDao handleWithdrawal

userdoc.notice: This contract is using SafeMath for uint, which is inherited from EpochUtils          Some events are moved to interface, easier for public uses          Staking contract will be deployed by KyberDao's contract
